sense.name: Make shorter than originally intended; reduce or retrench in length or duration; become short or shorter in duration.
sense.examples: He shortened his trip due to illness. In winter, the days shorten.

sense.name: Reduce in scope while retaining essential elements; edit by omitting or modifying parts considered indelicate.
sense.examples: The manuscript must be shortened. The government forced him to shorten the novel. She told the designer to shorten the skirt. Shorten the rope by a few inches.
